website_summaries.verdict: The Epson WorkForce DS-40 Color Portable Scanner lets you scan to a smartphone or tablet, so you can leave your laptop at home and still check scan quality on the spot.
pros: Can use batteries or a USB connection for power

customer_reviews.title: It says it’s compatiable with my Mac and software, ...
customer_reviews.text: It says it’s compatiable with my Mac and software, I was unable to use the disc to download the software because my laptop doesn’t accept discs. No biggie, there’s a way to download the software from the person website. I tried multiple times but I never got it to work. The help line was unhelpful so unfortunately I had to return it which is a bummer... I really could use this for work.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: I do however want to end on a positive note and say the design is lovely and great space saver also the shipping fast and delive
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and It was a PAIN to load onto my MAC 10.12 ........ took forever because it does not come with the updated software and I had to figure out that i needed to go to the epson site and get the news drivers ARGGGGG and I just finished that and it still is not working AHHHHH Im going to keep trying but if it does not get to work its getting sent right back . I do however want to end on a positive note and say the design is lovely and great space saver also the shipping fast and delivery women was sweet. :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Onorato

customer_reviews.title: I have been to client and family homes and can easily scan in the documents and photographs and later retrieve ...
customer_reviews.text: Being a Notary and also doing genealogy a lot, I have found this is a priceless to me. I also bought the hard case and power adapter. I have been to client and family homes and can easily scan in the documents and photographs and later retrieve them with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for a Mac
customer_reviews.text: It works, barely, sometimes. Lines and messy glitches. It constantly crashes and can't handle large documents. I hate giving bad reviews abut this just was horrible for me and almost cost me some major life issues when i needed a working scanner for major life events. I use a Mac and so maybe it words better on a PC but it was horrible on a Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Not for a MAC, drivers seem old and crusty.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t scan in color, driver crashes. Using on a Mac with OS X 10.13.6. Called tech support. Had enough, drivers seem immature. I have to a say that the ABBYY software was awesome, but the Epson software was confusing, overly complex and poorly documented. Find another scanner if you have a Mac. I’m going to get the canon LIDe 220.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY unless you purchase the 4-year warranty!!  Stopped working after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18-month warranty, and sure enough, it's 20 months and I can't even use the thing. It's in pristine condition... except for the scan. There are gray and bright blue stripes on every image. I've tried everything—the cleaning sheets, dusting air... nothing fixes this. $200 and it should work better with minimal use in 20 months. It's so obnoxious having plans (scanning all family photos!) and then the tools you invested in don't even work when you can finally get to the project. You can see the lines on the photo attached. Now I have an expensive paperweight...
customer_reviews.author: Anna Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Its very portable but the image quality isn't great. I thought I had the wrong setting or something because I still cant get good quality unless you put a blank white sheet behind it but even then its still not great. Its also REALLY hard to get it to load in straight since it doesnt have a feed area deep enough. If you just want to scan receipts or something simple and black and white it would be ok UPDATE: Stopped working completely after a year
customer_reviews.author: Yodelay

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use, not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a neat scanner (since neat no longer support desktop software). Using this scanner is very cumbersome, I use Paperport and Acrobat (as well as the Epson software) constant freezing, drivers lockup, scanner not recognized, etc. This went into the cabinet and the old scanner came back out. Since I cant return it perhaps after driver updates this may work better until then it will be collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Kvanwem

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is ideal for anyone that has to scan a lot of things and a flat bed scanner is to slow. This is fast! I have it used for B&W and color and it works great. I would recommend it! Oh, one problem, the instructions says to just set it up and start scanning...but it did not say — if you have TWO Epson scanners, you must tell your computer which Epson scanner to use. It would not scan and would not scan until I noticed the screen asking which scanner I wanted to use, Changed computer to DS-40, then it worked perfect! I have used it for small Rolodex cards and 8 1/2 x 11" sheets.
customer_reviews.author: extech

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, easy to use; tough to get clean
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. The directions could be more detailed, but overall it is a great scanner for the money. The scans are quick and clear, just what I needed. Updated to note that I am now unable to get it to scan without streaks thru the photos and documents I scan. I used both the included wet sheets and the dry one. Getting a new cleaning kit is $19.99. Way too expensive for me. But now the scanner is basically useless. I was so excited in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent document scanner.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best inexpensive document scanners you can find. Note: you cannot scan photos with this, so don't try! We use it as a scanner for documents we get with a product, then throw the originals away -- saves a lot of space. It's also very handy for scanning receipts you get at the retail stores. The wireless function works with no problems. I strongly recommend you purchase the adapter with it. The batteries work well but if you do any intense scanning, you will run out quickly. This product is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great portable USB scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Just received scanner. Been using 760/860 mode for work. Wanted a portable solution for documents. Downloaded software and installed. Comes with CD , manual, cable, and some type of cloth case. Relatively light, about size of box of rolled Oreo cookies. Once software installed, plug in. Easy to use software. Scans 1 page at a time,3-4 Pages per minute based on timed scanned. Clean scans. Adjustable contrast, brightness. Scans receipts (put near edge of scanner for recognition. Legible scanner text. Very good quality for money.
customer_reviews.author: RS So California

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner. It has enabled me to go paperless. Does everything I needed a desktop scanner too do. I would have given it five stars if it scanned double sided documents automatically. It is simple to use and file documents with. Worth every penny! Small footprint!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: clunky and terrible. I'm pretty sure it's leftover from Windows95 So ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a dead NEAT scanner for my company. With MAC OSX High Sierra, this thing is a turd. It's not compatible with Apple's Image Capture, software. You have to install Epson's Scan Utility which is slow, clunky and terrible. I'm pretty sure it's leftover from Windows95 So scanning in receipts for my business takes forever. I'm sending it back ASAP. Don't buy this if you 1) like any sort of speed. 2) Don't like installing third party software just to do some simple scanning.
customer_reviews.author: William Dennis

customer_reviews.title: ) The scans are excellent, the feed is consistent
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is an extremely energy efficient item-- runs on 2 AA batteries and even with CONSTANT use, batteries last for weeks. (By constant I mean for hours each day -big project- but not using the wireless function.) The scans are excellent, the feed is consistent, the software is overall very user-friendly. It's also a great size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: E Prince

customer_reviews.title: does what Epson says it does but this Amazon description is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Description clearly states scans directly to cloud. However, a computer must be in this "direct" path. Im sending back and looking for something that really scans direct or to an SD card so I can run receipts thru without having to mess with a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Prinz

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for light use for a couple of months, then when I really needed it - it just stopped working. No lights, no connection to the computer, nothing. There are no batteries or user serviceable parts at all - and the return policy was only for 30 days. Yikes. A $90 paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: David Aitken

customer_reviews.title: Okay Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Pros: My scanner arrived quickly, wasn't too difficult to set up and is lightweight and portable. Cons: It is so SLOOOOOOOOOW when you set it to a scan where you can actually read what you're scanning in. If you use the faster setting, the image is very blurry. Final thoughts: If I had to do it again, I would purchase a different scanner.
customer_reviews.author: TBE

customer_reviews.title: Does the job & very compact.
customer_reviews.text: I use it scan bills, documents, receipts, photos. Very useful little scanner. Great for when traveling. It takes up very little space. Please note it is not good for multiple page 5+ documents, for that a self feeder would be better. But for the single or few sheet documents scanning, it's perfect. My last one lasted three years, & I got my use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: BernieM

customer_reviews.title: difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This item was very difficult to use, and once we would get it started and scanned a few items, it would lock up. After trying to re-start it, we would resort to un-installing and re-installing the program. Sometimes this didn't even work. We wanted a scanner that we could put several items through at once - this is not an option. We have gone back to scanning with our printer - still just one page at a time, but works every time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it scans
customer_reviews.text: it works, but it constantly disconnects from my cpu, showing no power when I know it has power. usually I have to either unplug it replug it once a day or restart my cpu for it to power up. its acts like the cord is bad, but its not if that makes sense. its aggravating as hell to deal with on a daily basis. keep looking, its 2019...theres got to be better out there I promise you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portable scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why so many folks have trouble with this. I use with a Mac and no problems at all. Always works. I just upgraded to a DS-40 so let's see how that works! The auto-page feed feature that allows a sequence of manually-fed pages to add onto a single file is brilliant. Perfect for contracts. I really trust Epson for scanners.
customer_reviews.author: Software Maniac

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Results :(
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, so disappointing! Anything I tried to scan would always get stuck, and it took about 4-6 tries before I would get a usable image. I suspect this product would be great for documents and receipts (items that don't need great quality scans). The storage pouch was a nice addition, and the packaging was good. Pretty straightforward instruction on how to use.... but ultimately it doesn't produce a quality I am happy with so sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: had issues setting this up and Epson customer service was not great help. I suggest you immediately upgrade the software ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has kept me clutter free. I use it almost daily. While the Epson software does not upload directly to the cloud on Mac, if you use the third party software that comes with it you can do so. I, however, had issues setting this up and Epson customer service was not great help. I suggest you immediately upgrade the software after you install it.
customer_reviews.author: Meztli

customer_reviews.title: The wife is not happy with the resolution and the ease of figuring out ...
customer_reviews.text: The wife is not happy with the resolution and the ease of figuring out how to combine pages into one document. Should be easier! I also haven't found it easy to figure out how to do the wireless link.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Merchey

customer_reviews.title: I love the small size
customer_reviews.text: Use this every week approximately once a week. Have been using this for over a year and it has worked flawlessly. I love the small size. I just leave it in my drawer and pull it out when I need to scan something. No large scanner taking up my desktop space. It can do mult-page PDFs as well. Nice and simple and works well with Windows 10 what more can you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: DSHAH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Scanner does great for one page then without ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Scanner does great for one page then without fail jammed on page 2 despite 20 plus attempts with different papers, different locations, you name. It gave it a lot of patience. No luck. Packed up and returned. Will look for an alternative. Was not a deal killer but when I could get one page scanned it sure was sloooow.
customer_reviews.author: Pchop

customer_reviews.title: Good for the first hundred or so scans
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanned november of 2018 and use it for small batch scanning come tax time. I might have put 75- 100 scans through this device and this year when I went to get all my files digitized I found that the scanner was having issues with the software on my computer. Various troubleshooting steps later including repairing the scanner to the computer, checking for updated drivers, and reinstalling all epson software completely; I cannot scan a single document without the espon software 'not responding' at this point i have a paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Ouray & Kayla Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: First of all it is very handy and portable. Easy connection to the software. However, it is not easy to feed the papers. Most if the time it times out when I do scan multiple pages. So I have to start again. The button on the scanner is very convenient for this purpose as you just click and it does the job. The price is the bedt feature.
customer_reviews.author: Hamed M.

customer_reviews.title: It works fine now, and fairly quick once it starts
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble figuring out how to use it...you have to read the directions online and they are not all that clear. I thought it was really slow when hooked to the computer, but then I realized it pauses and I just had to move the curser. It works fine now, and fairly quick once it starts, but it is slow to start.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Litos

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: Simple software and really only minor performance complaints. Easy to use and maintain. Feedrate can really slowdown with higher resolution, but on medium settings the pace is fine and the resolution quite good. Only issue is the care that must be taken to put paper in at a close to 90deg angle so that there is very little skew to the page versus the image that comes out.
customer_reviews.author: BSS

customer_reviews.title: Works with the USB-C MacBook Pro with Touchbar
customer_reviews.text: This works with the Late-2016 MacBook Pro with Touchbar (USB-C) with the Apple branded USB-A to USB-C converter. The software could be better (you have to move the mouse in order for it to understand that it's done scanning), and choosing file location for each scan could be easier but the price is right and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: FroggyM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I move every few months, and toting around my important documents was a real hassle. Use this to digitize everything from important receipts to medical records. I'm not very tech savvy, so I don't make use of all the fancy features. Basic scanning is very simple, and that meets my needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - however will not work with Net Receipts ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - however will not work with Net Receipts software. Perfect for a "road-warrior" who needs light weight gear but business class functionality and capability when scanning documents on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Moore

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Don't bother with this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner will only give you problems unless you just have better luck than me. It gave me numerous problems, doesn't scan straight, the software doesn't work well on windows 10, and poor quality scans.
customer_reviews.author: l.l.

customer_reviews.title: Latest MacBook Pro and MacOS High Sierra - Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Go to the Epson web site and download the latest drivers, don’t waste your time with the included CD. Plug and play! Scan speed is acceptable equal to the Canon scanner this replaced.
customer_reviews.author: JNW

customer_reviews.title: If you have a MAC DON'T BUY IT- PEICE OF CRAP!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for christmas and never used it until tonight. I scanned 5 copies of documents perfectly, then the damn thing crapped out and crashed my brand new MACbook Pro! Following directions, installing, uninstalling several times and the damn thing doesn't work?
customer_reviews.author: Erin Piper Golden

customer_reviews.title: I loved it! Please add new software
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I put a new update on my mac it stopped working. I have down loaded the driver 10 times and sitl won't work. I loved it ! Please add new software !!
customer_reviews.author: Lex P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tax Doc Tool Must Have
customer_reviews.text: used it to scan in all tax documents. No more files! Easy, convenient, tucks away, and it was great for the purpose. Love it. Told my friends that are meeting planners, they should always have one on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy B

customer_reviews.title: I loved the product
customer_reviews.text: I loved the product, started working right away. Only drawbacks are - batteries dont last too long and you need to buy a separate AC/DC plug in if you dont want to use the scanner on batteries. The adapter is sold separately which ideally should have been provided with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Yodhey Patel

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner - except for the wireless part
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for simple document scanning tasks, and so far (still less than 100 scans) the DS-40 has worked well. Installation was straightforward. The Epson software is not the most intuitive, but it works. So far no scanning issues (streaking, refusal to feed). Operates cleanly via USB. However, I have not been able to successfully set up the WiFi connection, and that was one of the reasons I chose this scanner over wired-only models. Neither of our Macs even sees the device over WiFi. This may be going back despite the decent wired performance.
customer_reviews.author: DennisR

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner, some problems with WiFi setup to network, Scan to mobile works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get the USB (I am sure that it works for many), go with the high end wireless because this is a portable printer that you will want to quickly get scanned documents to the web drives like Google and Dropbox without having to power up a laptop. I did have the same problem as many connecting to my home office wireless but really, just connect with usb when around a home office or at the office.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H. Chitty

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm on both Windows and Mac platforms
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a portable work scanner and I am nothing shocked at how good this product is. No, you can't do super-duper high resolution scanning of photographs, but that is not what this is about. It is light. Powers through the USB cord. Scans in color, black/white or gray scale. And, it does a perfectly fine job for an on the road scanner. And, the lovely velour travel pouch is a bonus! I have had no problems using it or installing the necessary drivers/software.
customer_reviews.author: King David

customer_reviews.title: Won't send the scanned document to the printer.
customer_reviews.text: The Epson software will only print to an Epson printer. The software ignores all other printers you might have in windows. The software saves to a file OK. Here is the response from Epson tech support: Document Capture Pro feature to print only works with Epson Printers. Your feedback will be provided to our coders. Sorry it does not support other printers. Thank you Leo O. Epson ACS This is my first and last epson product.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: 5-star purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for uploading documents while traveling.....works like a charm....no issues. I have Windows 10 on my laptop and there wasn't an issue during installation or now in normal operation. The fact that it doesn't need a power cord sold me and is the main reason for getting this over many others. I will update this review if my 5-star rating changes for some reason, but if it continues to work like it has already, there won't be a need.
customer_reviews.author: D. N.

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a thick line down the center of the scanned image
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase this product for an easy way to scan photos. It is very easy to use, but very disappointingly, this leaves a thick line down the center of the scan. The resulting image looks terrible!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lunde

customer_reviews.title: the software that came with it did not connect and wasn't super user friendly
customer_reviews.text: could not get it to connect to any of the computers or laptops in our house and it has an outlet for a cord but no cord.... the software that came with it did not connect and wasn't super user friendly... i'm super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Dollface85

customer_reviews.title: Great for one page docs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple one sided scanner. Compact and comes with a case to protect it. I have found that doing more then one page is a issue. Other then that it works perfectly and is very quick. Comes with a software cd but you can also download the drivers from the epson website.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Lee

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: its cheap but it will get you out of a pinch. im really kinda surprised its still working hence the third star. if you dont mind your scans all sideways and baby sitting the silly thing at every turn this will probably be fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: The Drifter

customer_reviews.title: Hits and misses
customer_reviews.text: Documents get stick. They skip out half way through the scan. You have to wait for the automatic doc feeder to detect that you're trying to scan something. Doesnt do double sided. BUT has cut our scanning time in half and allows us the portability we needed.
customer_reviews.author: tat2me

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it’s made for
customer_reviews.text: A little bulky but does exactly what it is supposed to do. Keep in mind the quality isn’t perfect so use this for paperwork and receipts etc. photos will not look great it scanned.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tymer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mobile scanner. It really has changed the way I scan making it much much more convenient any time and at any place. Mobile scanning is fast efficient and helps with quick sharing across emails or any other app! Thank you, Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Vijay

customer_reviews.title: Fast, portable and efficient.  Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Two words.... A - Mazing!! Seriously, I love this thing. There's a time for a bed scanner, but this does 99.95% of what I need a scanner to do. It's small, powered by USB, fast and portable. No huge footprint like my last scanner. The quality of the hardware and software both are very good. Image quality is excellent. You can scan a whole box of photos in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific_Northwest_Guy

customer_reviews.title: It scans a full size page easily.
customer_reviews.text: As I try to build my small businesses, this comes in handy, I carry it with me when ever I am out and can instantly scan documents that will need to be referenced again. Makes things so much easier. It scans a full size page easily.
customer_reviews.author: MizzDe

customer_reviews.title: Died almost exactly to the year
customer_reviews.text: USB connector appears to have gotten loose over time and the scanner doesn't work any longer. The scanner was used maybe once a week. This might be good for a small job or two but I wouldn't count on this device for anything important.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Feeder breaks over time
customer_reviews.text: I used this infrequently to scan documents. Eventually (after maybe 50 scans, maybe 1 year's worth of use) the feeder started feeding the documents incorrectly. They would spin as they scanned, resulting in very funny but useless scans. There doesn't seem to be any way to clean the feeder or fix the problem, so I guess I'm going to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Hoy Loper

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: An exceptional portable document and image scanner. One of the best I ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Buford Wilson

customer_reviews.title: works...but now it developed a noise
customer_reviews.text: overall scanning one or a few pages is fine....After three months of use, it developed a noise as it scans...I don't think it degrades the performance, but it is just a new feature.
customer_reviews.author: j0

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful at home scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use, I was scanning within minutes of opening the box. I have eliminated A TON of paperwork but using this. I scan important documents and put them on a scan drive that I store in my safe. That way if there is a fire or theft I have all my personal documents as well as insurance information that I might need! Perfect for home use, probably not best in an office setting, I am sure there are more efficient scanners out there for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sara D.

customer_reviews.title: FAULTY ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I RECEIVED A FAULTY ITEM. THE LIGHT DOES NOT GO ON AT ALL. THAT MEANS THE SCANNER NEEDS TO BE RETURNED. UNFORTUNATELY I AM OUT OF THE COUNTRY AND CARRIED THE SCANNER WITHOUT CHECKING FIRST. I WOULD LIKE TO RETURN IT IN THREE WEEKS TIME BUT MY RETURN WINDOW IS CLOSED. IF THE SELLER LETS ME RETURN THIS SCANNER NOW, I WILL WITHDRAW MY NEGATIVE REVIEW. I DID NOT EXPECT SUCH A SMALL ELECTRONIC TO HAVE ANY ISSUES.
customer_reviews.author: Eunice W Menja

customer_reviews.title: Great; needs some different software.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Feeds rather quickly and comes with a disc that contains the software. The only negative (it might be a setting I haven't found) is that if there is a jam or misfeed of any kind you have to restart the scan.
customer_reviews.author: The Vander Velden's

customer_reviews.title: Good low end portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is a great portable workhorse. My husband shuttles it between home and work as needed and we've used it for everything from scanning our lease and car purchase documents to keeping important business cards. The software is easy to use and straightforward, and it's plug and play on most machines, making it instantly usable. Overall it's a great buy and should suffice for most home or business light use needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Epson offers Linux driver downloads, but they're old and don't work, and they won't support them. I emailed their support to ask for help with lots of details, and they replied "Important: Epson does not provide support for Linux drivers." Why offer drivers if you don't support them? It would have been nice to see that this won't work with Linux before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Not Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned it may not work with Windows 10. The Epson support site detected my version of Windows and I downloaded the necessary drivers and software. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: vickie at amazon

customer_reviews.title: Does much better for documents than pictures
customer_reviews.text: Does much better for documents than pictures. There always seems to be at least one linear artifact somewhere on every photo I scan, but I'm able to fix those blemishes with photograph software. Still, much faster than a flatbed scanner
customer_reviews.author: grandmaGigi

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product. I can bring it with me in my laptop bag if I need it, and it is small and fits in my drawer at home. Scans perfectly, plug and go. Unplug and put away. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too slow.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Slower than molasses. No multipage feeding. Everything is one slow page at a time. I am not sure the purpose of this when the Es-200 is out there that i got for double the price -- elsewhere of course. Works on Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Theoni LussosTop Contributor: Harmonicas

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a small scanner but won't work with El Capitan and third-party software
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for a small scanner. I use another scanning application on my Mac, and it won't work on El Capitan so I have been unable to upgrade my OS, have to stay on Yosemite. It comes with software that works with El Capitan but I don't really care for how that product works. So, I am getting by. The scans themselves are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: joeketch

customer_reviews.title: Works great but pay attention to the calibration instructions
customer_reviews.text: I got this for travelling and doing my expenses whilst spending weeks away. Works great but pay attention to the calibration instructions. I didn't and I ended up scanning the calibration sheet the wrong way round (despite what it said on the sheet) and I couldn't get a clear scan at all. When I realised my error two pc's later it worked perfectly. Software works well an not restricted to one computer. Nice size and comes with a protective bag for keeping it safe when travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has helped me on the go I scanned photos, documents, and cards. Also with the app it allows me to scan everything to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sosa

customer_reviews.title: It could be a bit faster at 600 DPI and have a better SW suite
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all with this little machine. It could be a bit faster at 600 DPI and have a better SW suite, however for the price it is a good deal and will please anyone who needs to be able to scan documents on the run with their laptop. It is perfect for luncheon business engagements away from the office where an immediate copy of documents is desired. It is the perfect companion for the laptop user on the go.
customer_reviews.author: spencer lee marshall

customer_reviews.title: Cloud scanning for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love the ability to scan directly to the cloud. The instructions could be better. And it would be better if you could scan to the cloud without interacting with the software (but that would be less secure). The speed and quality are great.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: so disappointed have to order another product
customer_reviews.text: worked 5 min, lost power would not connect, so disappointed have to order another product, serious problem at work
customer_reviews.author: Cruz Familia

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it twice so far but it seems to work well. I scanned in a document in a foreign language (Dutch) and converted it to English and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little scanner. It's exactly what I wanted. It looks like it's limited to scanning up to 14 inches long, which is only a problem when scanning long receipts. I just cut them in half and scan them. I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Small, durable and lets me stay paperless
customer_reviews.text: New Year's Resolution was to go as paperfree as possible. This scanner is a huge factor in my success. Bought the travel case for it, too, so I can keep up with work while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: BookBaron

customer_reviews.title: Love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: Love this scanner. My homework told me the Fujitsu was the number one portable scanner but it was more than twice the price. I took a chance on this one based upon the Amazon reviews and couldn't be more happy. Takes it's power from the USB connection; the software is what you expect from Epson (I've owned many of their scanners and printers); and it is well made. I don't expect to need another scanner for many, many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: BRO

customer_reviews.title: Good Portable Scanner for the Road Warrior
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good portable scanner for the traveling professional that needs to scan documents and receipts. I would not recommend this for scanning photographs and expect high quality results. It is small and light weight and reliable. For better results you might want to calibrate it before you scan a lot of documents if they have a color shift from the original.
customer_reviews.author: MacPC User

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for "every-now-and-then" use!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this at my office (for my personal use). Every now and then I get an e-mail with a document I need to sign and return via e-mail. I sign, save a copy of it directly to my computer and e-mail it right back within minutes!!! I also use it to scan business cards and anything else I USED to file away in folders... I love it!!!! PS. Best of all, you can use LONG file names to store legal docs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: mcm_9090

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional scans but not good for heavy scanning ...
customer_reviews.text: Good for occasional scans but not good for heavy scanning jobs. Bought it so I can scan documents while on remote job work sites. Worked great for the first few times but then quality of scan diminished.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use easy to set up , very slow to use though . Great if you're only doing a few things at a time but not if you have a bunch of doccuments to scan.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked well for about two weeks. Now, less than six months after purchase, IF I'm able to get it to turn on, I can scan one item and then the scanner becomes non-responsive. Then its a game of moving around the USB cable to other ports, restarting the computer, and sometime having to reinstall the program to get it to work. I would not recommend this scanner to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: ... is sleek and compact rins on batteries but not easy to connect to home wifi and wont connect via ...
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is sleek and compact rins on batteries but not easy to connect to home wifi and wont connect via thw usb port either good thing it can create its own wifi hub and it works good after figuring all that out good copys
customer_reviews.author: tom comstock

customer_reviews.title: pretty great product, for PC
customer_reviews.text: Used this to scan polaroids, works great on my PC, not so much on my mac. The PC auto size recognition works great, but on my mac it continues to fail to recognize the size of photos. I tried re installing the software but no luck. Amazing quality on the PC though!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for students on the go
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scanner. It fits neatly into my backpack and does everything I need it to. It is much cheaper than a similarly sized Neat scanner and the quality is excellent. Espon is a great brand for scanners and printers, and this little guy lives up to the Epson quality standard.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Radtke

customer_reviews.title: Epson portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love the product. I hate that there are so many apps associated with the scanner but that is the times we are in. Purchased the adapter from Epson because the battery use was not ideal for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Flawlezzlyimperfect

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like, would not accept paper to scan after repeated ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like, would not accept paper to scan after repeated attempts RETURNED FOR REFUND WAS ABLED TO USE LAPTOP TO SCAN WHICH WAS EASIER
customer_reviews.author: Victor M. Ortiz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for paper, not for photos
customer_reviews.text: This would be great if all you have to scan are papers. I tried using it to scan a photo, which resulted in a ruined photo. It starts to feed them askew and then jams. I would rate it higher if it worked for photos.
customer_reviews.author: Thresa G

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC little scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic! Saved me when I needed to get loan documents from a new client that didn't have the technology! Worked GREAT. Small enough to go ANYWHERE. Quality enough to work great and be reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Q

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY OUTDATED AND UNUSABLE ON MAC
customer_reviews.text: This looked like it was perfect for what I wanted it to do. I have a 10.11 OS Mac and it never occurred to me that this would only run on old, outdated systems. I saw the list of old systems, but I thought it went back that far not that it JUST worked with OLD systems. Live and learn. SO FIND SOMETHING ELSE IF YOU HAVE AN OS BEYOND 10.8!
customer_reviews.author: KathyBogle

customer_reviews.title: Scanning easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make my life paper free. I can easily scan to a pdf file and save bills and important papers to box.com on the cloud. Scanning on the main scanner was a hassle i had to climb the stairs to the computer room. Now, i can just do it on the laptop by pushing one button on the scanner and it's done. Love it and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Work ok at first. But didn't even last 90 days. Completely stopped working and won't even power on now. I tried a new USB power cable, still doesn't power on. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money spent
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. CD that came with it was unreadable but downloaded the drivers and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Scott1970

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use, but they need to improve the driver install (windows 7). I put the CD in to install, and the software installed, but the driver wouldn't. Ended up having to search for drivers on epson's website and install them from there to get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Zethelius

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for scanning in your images, and is extremely portable. It comes with a little bag to carry it around in, but it's kinda generic; I would have preferred a custom made bag/case for it, but I wouldn't knock off stars for that.
customer_reviews.author: ableekertomorrow

customer_reviews.title: Great portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: Most of the scanners I own are Epsons which have many of the same features re scanning. I like this one because it doesn't take up much room and allows scanning of loose letter and legal size documents as well as smaller ones. It's quiet and fast. I definitely enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: birdiered2

customer_reviews.title: Not a good scanner
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good. I was only able to scan one page and that took 6 attempts. I have a mac and it seems their drivers for the mac are not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Clark

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in last June. It worked great until last week when I tried to power it on and it will not turn on any more. I will be reaching out to Epson for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Nice little thing for scanning random documents
customer_reviews.text: I got this to scan in receipts and random hand written documents and business cards. The alignment usually works but 1 out of 3 times the feed is slightly off. It would have been nice if it had a extendable paper aligning guide. Quality of he scans are pretty good, not as good as one of those large office scanners but pretty decent for the price/size
customer_reviews.author: NewUser

customer_reviews.title: So unintuitive - I wasted two hours of my life just trying to connect ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awful if you have a Mac. So unintuitive - I wasted two hours of my life just trying to connect it to Wi-Fi. Buy this product at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hand

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce DS-40 Wireless Portable Document Scanner for PC and Mac, Sheet-fed, Mobile/Portable,Black
product_meta.description: Style:Wi-Fi & USB, 7.5ppmStay organized, wherever business takes you, with the WorkForce DS-40 wireless portable document scanner. At 1.1 lb, you can easily slip it into your briefcase and go. Quickly scan documents, business cards and more — up to 8.5" x 36" — to smartphones, tablets, laptops or cloud services including Dropbox, Google Drive and Evernote. With tools such as text enhancement, skew correction, Color Enhancement and Color Drop Out, scanning documents into editable text and searchable PDFs has never been easier. It also includes a TWAIN interface to support third-party document management software. Battery/USB-powered and lightweight, the DS-40 is perfect for mobile professionals.
feature_bullets: Wirelessly scan critical documents — scan and send receipts, statements, business/plastic cards and more to your smartphone, tablet, Mac, PC or popular cloud services
Lightweight and travel-friendly — at 1.1 lb, get the portability you need to capture data while on the road; battery or USB power source
Scan to popular cloud services — scan to Google Drive, Evernote, SharePoint, OneNote, SugarSync, Dropbox and more and output resolution is 50 – 1200 dpi
Create editable text and searchable PDFs — OCR and document management suite included for PDF and PDF/A files
Connect to document management software — TWAIN driver supported
NOTE: Refer the Instructional Video and the User Manual before use which is highly essential
